questions.question: What is the intellectual awakening in contemporary Indian society called?
Who established the Brahmo Samaj in Bengal in 1828?
Which newspaper was started by Raja Rammohan Roy to create public awareness?
The Paramhansa Sabha was established in Mumbai in 1848 by ________.
Who founded the Prarthana Samaj?
Which organization gave the slogan 'Back to the Vedas'?
Who wrote the book 'Satyarth Prakash'?
Who founded the Satyashodhak Samaj in 1873?
What was the main principle of the Satyashodhak Samaj?
The Aligarh Movement was led by ________.
Who established the Ramkrishna Mission in 1897?
At which place did Swami Vivekananda give his famous speech on Hinduism in 1893?
Which of these message was given by Swami Vivekananda to the youth?

options.text: Arise, Awake and stop not till the goal is achieved

questions.answer: Arise, Awake and stop not till the goal is achieved

questions.question: In which state did the Sikh community start the Singh Sabha movement?
Who started the first school for girls at Bhide Wada, Pune in 1848?
Which social reformer opened his own water reservoir for untouchables?
Who was the first female teacher in India?
questions.answer: Savitribai Phule was the first female teacher in India.

questions.question: Who started the 'Balhatya Pratibandhak Gruha' in his own house?
Gopal Hari Deshmukh is popularly known as ________.
Who wrote 'Shatapatre' to create social awareness through the weekly Prabhakar?
Whose efforts led to the passing of the Widow Remarriage Act in 1856?
The 'Vidhava Vivahottejak Mandali' was established by ________.
Who founded the 'Anath Balikashram' in 1907?
The first Women's University in India was established by ________.
Who established the 'Sharada Sadan' to help destitute women?
The 'Seva Sadan' institution was founded by ________.
Who wrote the book 'Stri-Purush Tulana'?
Who was the first Indian lady doctor?
Who started the 'Depressed Classes Mission' for the progress of Dalits in 1906?
Rajarshi Shahu Maharaj worked for the abolition of caste distinction in the state of ________.
Who led the movement for social equality for Dalits using the principle of 'self-respect'?
The 'Bahishkrut Hitkarini Sabha' was established by ________.
Who started the Satyagraha at Chavdar lake in Mahad?
Which social reformer was known as the pioneer of Indian Renaissance?
The principles of Humanity, Equality, and ________ were central to the Renaissance.
Which reformer studied multiple languages and religions to develop his ideology of Advaita philosophy?
The Satyashodhak Samaj was specifically founded for the progress of which groups?
The 'Anglo-Mohammedan Oriental College' later became known as ________.
Who was the founder of the Brahmo Samaj?
Which reformer fought against the Sati practice through persistent efforts?
Who established the Hindu College in Kolkata?
Who was the pioneer of the social reform movement in India?
The 'Paramhansa Sabha' principles included ________.
What was the motto of Satyashodhak Samaj?

options.text: Monotheism and universal brotherhood without middleman

questions.answer: Monotheism and universal brotherhood without middleman

questions.question: Swami Dayanand Saraswati founded the Arya Samaj in ________.
The main objective of Ramkrishna Mission was ________.
Which magazine/newspaper was associated with Maharshi Karve?
Who founded the Brahmo Samaj?
Rajarshi Shahu Maharaj gave reservation in the state of Kolhapur in ________.
Who wrote 'Gulamgiri' to protest against the class and caste inequality?
What was the impact of Western education on Indian society?
questions.answer: It spread new ideas, philosophies, and led to changes in social, religious, economic, and cultural aspects of Indian society.

questions.question: What is the 'Indian Renaissance'?
questions.answer: It refers to the intellectual awakening in 19th century India, marked by social, religious, and educational reforms.

questions.question: Who founded the Brahmo Samaj and when?
questions.answer: Raja Rammohan Roy founded the Brahmo Samaj in 1828 in Bengal.

questions.question: What were the principles of Brahmo Samaj?
questions.answer: Monotheism, caste and class equality, opposition to rituals, and emphasis on prayer.

questions.question: What social evils did Raja Rammohan Roy oppose?
questions.answer: He opposed Sati, child marriage, and the Purdah system.

questions.question: What did Raja Rammohan Roy promote?
questions.answer: He promoted widow remarriage and female education.

questions.question: Which newspaper did Raja Rammohan Roy start?
What was the Paramhansa Sabha?
questions.answer: An early reform group founded by Dadoba Pandurang Tarkhadkar in Mumbai in 1848, later replaced by Prarthana Samaj.

questions.question: Who was the first President of Prarthana Samaj?
Who were prominent leaders of Prarthana Samaj?
questions.answer: Justice Ranade and Dr. R. G. Bhandarkar.

questions.question: What were the principles of Prarthana Samaj?
questions.answer: Opposition to idol worship, monotheism, rejection of rituals, and emphasis on devotion and prayer.

questions.question: What social work did Prarthana Samaj undertake?
questions.answer: It started orphanages, women's education institutes, night schools for workers, and societies for Dalits.

questions.question: Who founded the Depressed Classes Mission?
questions.answer: Maharshi Vithal Ramji Shinde, a member of Prarthana Samaj.

questions.question: Who founded Satyashodhak Samaj and when?
questions.answer: Mahatma Jyotirao Phule founded Satyashodhak Samaj in 1873.

questions.question: What was the principle of Satyashodhak Samaj?
questions.answer: To form a society based on equality.

questions.question: What did Mahatma Phule advocate?
questions.answer: He advocated education for depressed classes and women, and opposed untouchability and discrimination.

questions.question: Name some books written by Mahatma Phule.
Who founded Arya Samaj and when?
questions.answer: Swami Dayanand Saraswati founded Arya Samaj in 1875.

questions.question: What was the slogan of Arya Samaj?
Which book did Swami Dayanand Saraswati write?
questions.answer: Satyarth Prakash, a commentary on the Vedas.

questions.question: What did Arya Samaj promote?
questions.answer: Vedic religion, gender equality, opposition to casteism, and education.

questions.question: Who founded the Ramkrishna Mission and when?
questions.answer: Swami Vivekananda founded the Ramkrishna Mission in 1897.

questions.question: What were the main activities of Ramkrishna Mission?
questions.answer: Service to society, famine relief, medical help for the poor, female education, and spiritual growth.

questions.question: Where did Swami Vivekananda represent Hinduism in 1893?
questions.answer: At the Parliament of Religions in Chicago.

questions.question: What was Swami Vivekananda's message to Indian youth?
questions.answer: 'Arise, Awake and stop not till the goal is achieved.'

questions.question: Which organization worked for Sikh religious reforms?
questions.answer: The Singh Sabha, established in Amritsar.

questions.question: What did the Singh Sabha promote?
questions.answer: Education among Sikhs and modernization of the community.

questions.question: What was the condition of women in 19th century India?
questions.answer: Miserable—no education rights, treated unequally, and suffering from child marriage, dowry, Sati, and restrictions on widow remarriage.

questions.question: Who helped pass the Sati Prohibition Act?
questions.answer: Lord Bentinck, with the help of Raja Rammohan Roy.

questions.question: Who was known as 'Lokhitwadi'?
Where and when did Mahatma Phule open the first girls' school?
questions.answer: At Bhide Wada in Pune in 1848.

questions.question: Who supported Mahatma Phule in his educational work?
What did Mahatma Phule establish in his house?
questions.answer: 'Bal Hatya Pratibandhak Gruha'—a home to prevent infanticide.

questions.question: Why did Mahatma Phule conduct a barbers' strike?
questions.answer: To protest against the custom of shaving widows' heads.

questions.question: Who advocated for widow remarriage?
questions.answer: Pandit Ishwarchandra Vidyasagar, Vishnushastri Pandit, and Vireshalingam.

questions.question: Which newspaper did Gopal Ganesh Agarkar run?
What did Tarabai Shinde write?
questions.answer: 'Stri Purush Tulana', a book on women's rights.

questions.question: What did Maharshi Dhondo Karve start?
What is Maharshi Karve known for?
questions.answer: Starting the first women's university in India in the 20th century.

questions.question: Who founded Sharada Sadan?
What did Ramabai Ranade start?
questions.answer: Nursing courses for women through Seva Sadan Institute.

questions.question: What did women gain through the reform movement?
questions.answer: Education, voice against injustice, and participation in social and national life.

questions.question: Who started reforms among Muslims in Bengal?
questions.answer: Abdul Latif, who founded The Mohammedan Literary Society.

questions.question: Who founded the Mohammedan Anglo Oriental College?
What later became the Aligarh Muslim University?
What did Sir Sayyad Ahmad Khan advocate?
questions.answer: Western science, technology, and modern education for Muslims.

questions.question: When was Hindu Mahasabha established?
Who founded Banaras Hindu University?
Who founded the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) and when?
questions.answer: Dr. Keshav Baliram Hedgewar founded RSS in 1925 in Nagpur.

questions.question: What was the aim of RSS?
questions.answer: To build a disciplined and virtuous organization of Hindu youth.

questions.question: Who built the Patit Pawan Temple?
questions.answer: V.D. Savarkar in Ratnagiri, open to all Hindu castes.

questions.question: What were common dining programmes?
questions.answer: Meals organized for people of all castes to promote equality.

questions.question: Who received the Nobel Prize in Literature from India?
Who received the Nobel Prize in Science from India?
How did literature contribute to social reform?
questions.answer: Stories and novels inspired independence and expressed reformist ideas.

questions.question: What role did newspapers play during the Renaissance?
questions.answer: They became a source of social reform and political awakening.

questions.question: What happened in the field of art during this period?
questions.answer: Indian and Western styles merged, creating a new school of painting.

questions.question: What was emphasized for national progress?
What is the historical significance of the Renaissance movement?
questions.answer: It laid the foundation for a nationwide political movement based on liberty, equality, and nationalism.

questions.question: What did Maharshi Vithal Ramji Shinde organize against?
Who demanded the right to vote for women?
Who spoke about injustice towards women through articles?
Who supported women's education besides social reformers?
What was the role of women in the freedom movement?
questions.answer: They gave valuable contributions in various capacities.

questions.question: What positive change came in women's lives due to education?
questions.answer: They gained confidence, started expressing their thoughts, and excelled in various fields.

questions.question: What kind of books did women start writing?
questions.answer: Books on social issues, women's rights, and reformist ideas.

questions.question: What was the Akali movement?
questions.answer: A continuation of the Sikh reform tradition started by Singh Sabha.

questions.question: What was the attitude of Indian reformers towards rituals?
questions.answer: Most opposed blind rituals and emphasized simplicity and spirituality.

questions.question: Which reformer is associated with 'Gulamgiri'?
What was the main focus of Arya Samaj's educational work?
questions.answer: Establishing schools and colleges based on Vedic principles.

questions.question: Who is considered a pioneer of female education in Maharashtra?
What was the 'Parliament of Religions'?
questions.answer: An international conference where Swami Vivekananda represented Hinduism in 1893.

questions.question: Which reformer worked for the upliftment of Dalits?
questions.answer: Maharshi Vithal Ramji Shinde through the Depressed Classes Mission.

questions.question: Who founded the 'Seva Sadan Institute'?
What was the 'Hindu College' founded by Raja Rammohan Roy?
questions.answer: An institution to promote modern education in Kolkata.

questions.question: What did social reformers think about caste discrimination?
questions.answer: They opposed it and worked for a casteless society based on equality.

questions.question: What is meant by 'Monotheism' in Brahmo Samaj?
questions.answer: Belief in one God, rejecting idol worship and polytheism.

questions.question: How did Prarthana Samaj help workers?
questions.answer: By starting night schools for their education.

questions.question: What did Mahatma Phule criticize in his writings?
questions.answer: Discrimination based on gender, caste, and social hierarchy.

questions.question: Who was known as the 'father of modern Indian education'?
questions.answer: Though not explicitly stated, Raja Rammohan Roy and later reformers like Phule and Karve are considered pioneers.

questions.question: What was the role of music during the Renaissance?
questions.answer: It became more popular and was used as a medium for cultural revival.

questions.question: Who wrote 'Shatapatre'?
What did 'Shatapatre' advocate?
questions.answer: Gender equality and social reforms through letters.

questions.question: Which reformer is associated with 'Anath Balikashram'?
What was Savitribai Phule's contribution to education?
questions.answer: She taught at and supported the first girls' school despite social opposition.

questions.question: Who founded the 'The Mohammedan Literary Society'?
What was the main objective of Aligarh movement?
questions.answer: To modernize Muslim education and promote scientific learning.

questions.question: Who started the 'Bal Hatya Pratibandhak Gruha'?
What did the 'Depressed Classes Mission' focus on?
questions.answer: Solving social problems of Dalits and promoting their welfare.

questions.question: Which reformer is known for opposing the Devdasi system?
What was Tarabai Shinde's book about?
questions.answer: Comparison between men and women, advocating women's rights.

questions.question: Who started the first women's university in India?
What was the impact of the Renaissance on Indian nationalism?
questions.answer: It fostered unity, self-respect, and a desire for political freedom.

questions.question: Which reformer worked for Hindu unity and discipline?
questions.answer: Dr. Keshav Baliram Hedgewar through RSS.

questions.question: What did V.D. Savarkar promote through Patit Pawan Temple?
How did science gain importance during the Renaissance?
questions.answer: People recognized its role in national progress and development.

questions.question: Who were the main advocates of widow remarriage?
What was the role of 'Sudharak' newspaper?
questions.answer: It expressed strong opinions against child marriage and for social reforms.

questions.question: Who inspired the phrase 'Go Back to the Vedas'?
questions.answer: Swami Dayanand Saraswati of Arya Samaj.

questions.question: What is the lasting legacy of the 19th century social reformers?
questions.answer: They challenged regressive customs, promoted education and equality, and laid the groundwork for modern India.
